FIELD OFFICE TAIPEI, TAIWAN. P. O. BOX NO. 23 TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, TAIPEI.
THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION ENGINEERS AND CONSTRUCTORS 8 O BROAD STREET NEW YORK 4, N. Y.
TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, NEW YORK
年
April 23, 1962 File Ref. MSA-33.4
Mr. C. C, Chang, Chief Second Division Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
Subject: Excess Equipment Project No. 84-99-471
Dear Mr. Chang:
With reference to your C2-62-1181 letter, dated 20 April regarding re-allocation of five (5) Gray Marine Diesel Engines, which were allocated to TPC approximately two years ago, we are sending copies of this letter and copies of your letter to both Keelung and Kaohsiung Harbor Bureau.
White Engineering have been doing research for some time past, to obtain two or more Marine Diesel Engines for KaHB but has been unable to obtain any from current offerings.
Inasmuch as we have no knowledge of the condition of these five units, nor the size and speed ratings, we feel that perhaps it would be best if the two Bureaus made their own investigation and contacted CUSA, Second Division directly if they desire a transfer.
We shall also pass this on, for what it's worth, to THB and PWB. who may have an interest in acquisition.

Very truly yours, THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION
e. D. OTT. G. E. Otto Spec. Writer & Bid Analyst

paragraphs.content: FIELD OFFICE TAIPEI, TAIWAN. P. O. BOX NO. 23 TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, TAIPEI.
THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION ENGINEERS AND CONSTRUCTORS 8 O BROAD STREET NEW YORK 4, N. Y.
Mr. C. C, Chang, Chief Second Division Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan

With reference to your C2-62-1181 letter, dated 20 April regarding re-allocation of five (5) Gray Marine Diesel Engines, which were allocated to TPC approximately two years ago, we are sending copies of this letter and copies of your letter to both Keelung and Kaohsiung Harbor Bureau.
White Engineering have been doing research for some time past, to obtain two or more Marine Diesel Engines for KaHB but has been unable to obtain any from current offerings.

Inasmuch as we have no knowledge of the condition of these five units, nor the size and speed ratings, we feel that perhaps it would be best if the two Bureaus made their own investigation and contacted CUSA, Second Division directly if they desire a transfer.
We shall also pass this on, for what it's worth, to THB and PWB. who may have an interest in acquisition.
Very truly yours, THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION
e. D. OTT. G. E. Otto Spec. Writer & Bid Analyst
